Reviews.Title: “really good”
Reviews.Author: cecile725
Reviews.Content: i stay there for one night Great room and its clear good services but this hotel is refitting now so the air sometime terrible in the corridor access area overall really good

Reviews.Title: “A hotel on the mend”
Reviews.Author: mitchcolgan
Reviews.Content: Well, after all was said and done, I would say that I'm pleased with our recent stay at the Hotel Edward, though there were certainly some ups and downs. The biggest challenge that we encountered was the fact that the hotel is currently in a state of transition and upgrade. This means that the rooms were very nice and stylish, but the lift didn't work and there were workers pounding away beginning first thing in the morning on the new lobby area. When we checked into the hotel, we were told our room was on the 5th floor, which shouldn't have been a problem...except the elevator wasn't working. So we had to lug our bags all the way up the narrow steps. Fortunately, the receptionist (who was very nice) was able to change our room to the 1st floor for the remainder of the trip to avoid a heart attack going up and down the stairs! Wireless internet was free, but it seemed to come and go throughout the day. Our second room (after the switch to the 1st floor) was right above the street, so there was quite a bit of noise through the drafty windows. But we were so jet lagged, we barely noticed! Overall, nice hotel with a fantastic location to the tube. You can't be it for the simple fact that you can be to the tube in less than 5 minutes -- very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful and inflexible”
Reviews.Author: Frey276
Reviews.Content: Unhelpful, inflexible management and staff who do not know how to treat potential customers. Wouldn't allow cancellation after I mistakenly made an online booking through tripadvisor for a room for one night that I didn't need even when I called them 5 minutes after making the booking to tell them of my mistake (the very helpful Tripadvisor help centre assistant also called them to no avail).

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: ALEXD26
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels i've stayed in London!The rooms are a little small but fully renovated in a very modern way.The reception area needs a renovation too but it did not matter.The location is great, just 1 block from the metro station and lots of pubs and restaurants around it.I would definetely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and dirty”
Reviews.Author: WindddSurfer
Reviews.Content: The only advantage is it is close to paddington but it does not justify a room price of 100 pounds.. Rooms are renovated but the service is awful.. I stayed for 3 nights and noticed that the people who are coming in to clean the rooms are just covering your bed. No toilet cleanining, no was basin cleaning..i also heard from some other hotel guests that there were some creatures :) in the room.. I didnt have fortunately. Rooms are so so so tiny.. Windows are poor..it is all windy in the room.. You can hardly balance the temperature by the hot air conditioning..i would never ever stay in this hotel..also the breakfast is very poor..

Reviews.Title: “Well renovated.”
Reviews.Author: Mutakan S
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location but very very small bathroom..

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for 65quid last minute triple room”
Reviews.Author: holylembu
Reviews.Content: Hotel is newly renovated, stop it's clean and everything is new. No bed bugs for sure. Rain shower and fits , so it's a plus there for me. Room was small and akward but the interior design made up for it. Didn't have breakfast. Managed to get extra towels in the middle of the night, another plus. Bad, Bed soft and double bed was combination of two single bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, surprisngly modern room, ideal for a couple.”
Reviews.Author: WheresNextT
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived and scaffolding was around the building, which panicked us slightly. We soon realised they were refurbishing the whole hotel. The reception/sofa area isn't anything special, but the staff behind the desk were helpful enough. We asked to leave our backpacks with them as we were too early to check-in to the room, which wasn't a problem, however the lockable cupboard was on the ground floor where the builders were working, so was a bit awkward and unsafe to get to. When we were able to check into the room we were amazed. It was a brand new refurbished modern room - Large clean bed, 32" LCD television mounted on the wall, usual tea/coffee facilities, good sized and modern clean bathroom. We didn't have much of a view but we were only there for one night so didn't matter Breakfast was your average toast, coco pops and yogurts. We settled for this but we were in London so if we were that bothered we could have found a nice little cafÃ© for something more. We went through a comparison price website to find cheap accommodation/deals, however if you went direct to the hotels website, it doesn't appear to be that cheap. So I think we managed to get a bargain. Great nights sleep. Would deffinately go back.

Reviews.Title: “its not what it used to be, try it”
Reviews.Author: 63pablo63
Reviews.Content: all the prviouse reveiws of this hotel should be deleted because its not fare on the hotel which has had a very well thought and well designed refurbishment. I travel to london alot and this is by far the most morden hotel i've ever stayed in. Reception was very willing to help and its a shame i didnt take picture to prove my point. give it a try you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Alice295
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June. Location was great; walking distance to train station. Many nice restaurants are nearby as well as convenience stores for drinks and snacks. The room was very clean with comfortable bed. Breakfast was good although limited time. The staff was really helpful with the multitude of questions I had (many thanks to the hotel Manager!) I would definitely stay here again on return to London!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: barbara_mountjoy
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much as the hotel was so near Paddington, but we were pleasantly surprised. The twin room had just been refurbished and it was great to have a quiet running airconditioning unit. The staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was good althought there was only a choice of corn flakes or choco rice crispies for cereal - a healthier selection would have been better. There was a hospitality tray in the room and a lift to get us there. We were able to store our luggage for free on our departure day and collect later.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: micheevans
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel they were having some building work done on the 'outside' of the hotel. We eventually got to our room and the rubble from the building work was falling down into the walls AND coming through the ceiling of the bathroom in our room!! I also specifically asked for 3 single beds in our room so they gave us a double and a sofa bed. We went down and complained and the manager came and had a look for herself and she couldnt apologise enough and said she would upgrade us to a better room the next day which to be fair, she did. We went down to the reception the next day to see if our new room was ready as we would be out for the day, the lady on reception had no idea what we were talking about and told us to wait for the manager. Staff communication doesnt seem to be there strong point either. They also charged us a different price from what was on my invoice, it doesnt tell you either that you will have to pay when you get there, not when you check out. There reason for charging us a different price was 'in the hotel business the price changes all the time' so be warned. Really all you are paying for with this hotel is the location as it is literally a 2 minute walk from paddington station and a 5 minute walk if that to the nearest tube station. Overall i was very disappointed with the hotel and will not be rushing back there anytime soon!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID !!! Fawlty towers but worse.Very Rude reception.”
Reviews.Author: Frankter
Reviews.Content: Major construction on while we stayed. Lots of dust and noise. Why have a hotel open when you are doing major building work? Very RUDE reception. You would get more response from talking to a brick wall. On returning from a day out recception had locked the front door and no guests could get into the hotel for half and hour then reception opened the front door with her dinner in hand. Guests ring outside via mobile not even answered. Went water pored through the roof at 2am we had trouble getting the room changed. Power sockets very dangerous. rooms unclean. Worse hotel I have ever stayed in, I would rather sleep on the street or on a park bench. AVOID !!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT USE”
Reviews.Author: bikegeezer
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. DO NOT USE IT. The foyer looks lovley and the pictures on the internet look great. Behind that is the dirtiest, least looked after place I have ever been in. Bags of laundry left in the corridor, hoovers left so you trip over them as you walk through a door. Beds were comfy but they are made with a sheet and an extremly thin blanket, no quilts. The toaster at breakfast only toasted one side and the elevator only works on the bottom floors. Non of the staff speak very good English and any complaint is passed on to the 'manager' who is out with a promise of a discount on your 'next visit'. I should have read the previous reviews on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: prozac
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with 3 others, the room was clean, but customer service was woeful. We told the person at the desk our kettle in the room did not work, and all they did was shrug their shoulders? At breakfast in the basement is the slowest toaster i have had the misfortune to use, in-appropriate when you have 12 people queuing. We ate at a fantastic italian restuarant across the road from Hotel Edward which made our day brighter.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: jennifer_young200
Reviews.Content: My welcome at reception when I arrived was the worst I have ever experienced. The glum young man behind the desk was slowly putting a stack of papers one by one into a large ringbinder when I came in, and barely acknowledged me. He said "A minute" then proceeded to spend what seemed like ages finishing this task before saying '"stupid day." When he finally finished, I told him my name and my reservation to which he gruffly stated the price of my stay. Trying to remain cheerful, I asked if he'd had a bad day. He said he had "mixed up all the stupid payments." As I was just about to pay, this didn't exactly fill me with confidence! As I had an important interview the next morning, I asked if there was an iron I could use, but the chap did not speak much english and didn't understand. After miming the act of ironing a shirt, he said "we don't have this." He advised me to check in the morning. (The morning staff dealt with this request much more impressively!) The room was OK, apart from a very mouldy shower curtain which made the bathroom smell horrible, and the curtains on the window were a foot short which meant there was no privacy. I had to attatch a blanket to the bottom of the curtain with hairclips so I could undress!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel......bed bugs...faulty towers!'”
Reviews.Author: bedbugs_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel back in jan 2011 for the royal wedding weekend....when we arrived,the reception assistant didn't know much about parking as was foreign and said he didn't drive....the lift was broken...so we had to struggle up 7 flights of stairs with our luggage..my husband has a bad back,he wwas aching all royal wedding day and took pain killers....room was pokey,no shower gel provided,only shampoo,and one of the electrical sockets was faulty(unless you wiggled the plug around a bit) was crackling..we didn't arrive until midnight so just wanted a sleep...got in bed and we both started itching..in the end I put my coat on and slept in it....breakfast was awful with a toaster that needed chucking,and a soiled matress leaning up one of the dining room windows...yuk! we had booked 2 nights but after royal wedding ,checked out,we were informed the lift regularly broke down...told them about itching and was offered another room in the basement..no thanks! No refund for night we didn't want to stop(Â£85 lost) worst hotel we have stayed in..and my husband had tiny bites over both his ankles the next day...I wore socks thank god.....They did refund for the parking we had paid for for the saturday we had lost...

Reviews.Title: “A Faulty Towers Aspect...”
Reviews.Author: cahro
Reviews.Content: This hotel even though the location is excellent and the rates are correct, had a "Faulty Towers aspect..." I arrived at the hotel on the Sunday night to be told that the elevator was not working but would be fixed tomorrow (Monday). Then I was given the key to my 5th floor room! The stairway with its fire doors was a major challenge with luggage... Monday came and went, Tuesday and Wednesday, idem with each of the reception people giving a new story...good thing nobody was stuck in the elevator...they would have been mighty hungry. The toaster in the breakfast room was hilarious...only one side of the bread toasted and the other side was well, untoasted. The person on duty didn't really speak enough English to understand what was happening and made numerous trips to the garbage with the carbonised pieces of bread...and at one point the breakfast room was blanketed in a cloud of smoke... :-)...they opened the fire doors to let the smoke out. I wondered why the smoke detecter didn't start ringing... Let's not even talk about the air extraction in the bathrooms...

Reviews.Title: “OVERBOOKING!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1957Tina
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this disgusting hotel. We had booked an overnight stay on 6th March to celebrate my birthday and had also booked a show in the evening. We arrived at 5.00 pm to freshen up and were advised that the hotel was overbooked!! There were no apologies from the poorly trained and inexperienced 'Receptionist??' and we were told to go to their sister hotel 'Arriva' in Kings Cross. We agreed to go but the traffic was horrendous and after about 45 minutes of travelling through London (luckily we were in the car) we contacted the so-called Receptionist at the above Hotel and advised that we would not be going to that hotel and that under no circumstances should she charge our credit card. She reassured us that she would not. We were then forced to go straight to the theatre (having travelled for 4 hours now) without being able to freshen up or change and then to return home. What was meant to be a pleasurable and leisurely Birthday treat was marred by this experience. Fortunately, we were travelling by car, but dread to think what would have happened had we been on foot. Also, we were travelling internally (from Birmingham to London). What kind of impression does this create on our overseas visitors??? An appalling establishment overall.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE KITCHEN STAFF”
Reviews.Author: emily81Belfast
Reviews.Content: Hotel central and price good but kitchen staff were so nasty . Arrived down for breakfast at 9.15 had our cereal and orange went and but toast on and a few seconds later kitchen staff took toaster with toast and informed us breakfast was over.Then i asked for milk for my tea as told it was back in fridge and breakfast was over.

Reviews.Title: “cockroach in bath”
Reviews.Author: jugs1977
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for the location which was excellent for what we had planned for our 3 night stay. on first look the hotel looked nice staff were friendly and helpful, I am disabled and they helped me up the front steps when needed, we didn't eat at hotel as thought Â£7 was a bit much for continental and not a full breakfast. Room was ok, until we got back one night and found a cockroach in the bath, hadn't taken much notice of the marble floor until then but on closer inspection round the bath and under the sink clearly hadn't seen a mop in weeks. When we complained the next day the manageress refused to come out and speak to us, hiding behind a screen behing the reception desk, I asked for one night to be refunded but all she would give us was Â£20

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: andie1068946
Reviews.Content: The room was small and dirty - and it turned out it was full of bed bugs !! They bit me so bad, I had to go to see a doctor. I dont recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Riddled with bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: LornaB1979
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is the location. We went down to London for Hard Rock Calling in Hyde Park so it was ideal but apart from that it's basically a dump. I struggled to find accomodation in the area reasonably priced so booked this hotel without reading reviews. Before leaving I came across several reviews saying there are bed bugs but thought surely not!! Well, that was 1 week ago and now both myself and my husband have came out in itchy small lumps which cannot otherwise be explained. Apparently bed bug bites can take upto 9 days to appear so there's a pretty good chance that's what it is. Gross!!!! Be warned!!!! If you're looking for a nice hotel for a romantic getaway avoid like the plague!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hot, Hot, Hot!!”
Reviews.Author: Spencers2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Edward Hotel for one night only as we were going to the Hyde Park Calling Concert. The hotel is a perfect location if want to see the trendy parts of London (Bars, Resturants etc) There is a small street near the hotel that has some lovely houses, very pretty and looks like something out of a typical British Movie. Okay...about the hotel...We stayed in London when it was the hottest day of the year so far and our room was on the top floor, with the smallest window and no air whatsoever! Hardly slept and when we finally fell asleep, was woken up by the lift in the hotel. The rooms are tiny, very old fashioned and far too warm to stay in in the summer. Dont expect anything great and if you suffer with claustrophobia...don't even go there!

Reviews.Title: “Dingy hotel convenient for Victoria station if you're not fussy”
Reviews.Author: Denmead-Couple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convenience overnighter in London, booked relatively late and it was one of only a handful of reasonably priced hotels in the area. Arrived 9:30pm, waited about 10 minutes to be served but only due to receptionist trying to be helpful to overseas student guest with neverending list of questions, and another guest querying the free wifi ("it's not working today"). Old style hotel much in need of a spruce up; tatty paintwork and carpets, and various stores and black bin liners laying around the reception area . Was initially given the keys to what turned out to be a poky twin room (wasn't asked whether I wanted a double) - returned and asked for a double and was given 'Room 5', although receptionist seemed concerned as to whether it would be suitable given it's in the basement. Actually, room 5 is down twisty stairs, round the back of reception, past the vacuum cleaner and is a small passage off what appeared (in the evening) to be a staff room but in the morning what turned out to be the breakfast room. Actually when you get to room 5, it's quite good - reasonably spacious, decently furnished and recently decorated, with large ensuite, although carpets need a good clean. Room was initially noisy being next to machinery space and water running down gutters, but slept well. Still, glad to leave it in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: monostory
Reviews.Content: I suppose they don't discriminate their customers, thus, it is also supposed that my experiences are general. The floor was neither horizontal, nor flat. Therefore the head section of the bed was lower than its other end. According to the information leaflet, wireless internet is available, but it is not true. Although the breakfast was included in the room rate, the breakfast room hostess was not notified about it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Jewitch
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel close to Paddington Station & Heathrow Express, & found the Edward on lastminute.com. The Edward is one block from the station, on a well-lit street. I never felt any safety issues going back to the hotel at night; as a female my safety is important. I checked in & was mistakenly given a room already occupied. The staff was apologetic & changed my room immediately. The room was basic but really clean & quiet, the bed was comfortable, the blanket warm. There was an extra blanket & pillow in the room. I didn't breakfast at the hotel, but there were plenty of places in the area to eat, including the usual train-station eateries, & a small shop next to the hotel sold lovely fresh fruit. My biggest complaint is that the room needed a garbage can, there was only the tiny one in the bathroom. My biggest surprise was that the cleaner didn't pick up the tip I left her/him each morning.

Reviews.Title: “avoid, avoid & avoid again!!!”
Reviews.Author: fleabear
Reviews.Content: two words should say it all - BED BUGS!!! Do not go near this hotel. Dirty, horrible rooms bad service..and rude staff. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with average services”
Reviews.Author: basitRiyadh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located within Paddington area with easy access to buses, under ground station and railway station. Plenty of places to eat. Bayswater and Queensway are within walking distance. Hyde Park and the shopping area of Oxford Street are only few miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Low-priced accommodation - not the fanciest, but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: rmsrmsrms
Reviews.Content: My friend and I needed a place to stay for 3 nights so after checking around the internet, this seem to be economical enough without having a lot of really bad reviews. (So many of the cheaper places just had the worse reviews). We had no problems staying here. It is a great location (for rail, bus or tube) and one can walk to the park easily. We felt safe in the neighborhood. The hotel from the outside and the lobby is nice, well kept and clean. The desk staff was always friendly and helpful. Overall the hotel and our room were quiet. Now it is the general nature of many hotels in Europe . . . that they tend to be a little more frail around the edges than many non Europeans are use too or expect. So a few thing a very picky person might complain about, well I just chalk it up to staying in a building that is at least 100 years old. The room was small and basic with basic furnishing, yes the carpet had seen better day, and a modern window and new door would have done wonder. But in the end, it was more than acceptable given the price we paid. I would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, ok hotel in good situation for budget”
Reviews.Author: Pyrtsi
Reviews.Content: The situation was good and the reception worked well. Considering the prices in London, this was a good hotel. Although not everything worked well. There were some dirt around the room, in window courtains and corners etc. The toilet flush didn't work very well, sometime you had to flush many times to make your wastings disappear... The windows were thin and there was some noice from the street. Perhaps a nearby hospital, because there was lots of ambulances going around the area. But as I said, the main accommodation worked and the prices weren't bad.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stu”
Reviews.Author: Lola3076
Reviews.Content: On one hand, It was a great hotel, well situated, tube station very close which make thing really easy. On the other hand it was very clean and the stuff was kind and friendly. In conclusion, it was much better than i thought and a really good place to stay for an economic price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bed bugs bite!”
Reviews.Author: amerie_8
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a one night stay at Edward Hotel Paddington. When we checked in we were given a room that had quite obviously not been cleaned. The toilet had not been flushed after the previous occupants. There were dirty shampoo wrappers and tissues in the bath, a dirty wet and used towel in the bath tub. The phone wasn't working so we couldnt even call reception to let them know the situation and had to use our mobiles! Once Downstairs our complaints were brushed aside instead we were offered to joing the hotels priority club! We were given a new room which on the face of it looked marginally better. Until the next morning of course when we woke up scratching ! We had been bitten by bed bugs! We stupidly ignored the reviews we had read about this Hotel, and I am now paying for it as i scratch feverishly. Again after checking out our concerns were just brushed aside. I would advise any visitor to really think twice and really weigh out the pros and cons before choosing this hotel. The only good thing is the Location. I will not be returning to this hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmmmmmmind the gap!!”
Reviews.Author: tata81
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an excellent two star one, with private facilities and tea & coffee boiler.. Perfect to stay in for a holiday.. Really pleasant!! Truly recommended... :-)

Reviews.Title: “where did they get the stars from?”
Reviews.Author: salex66
Reviews.Content: my wife and I booked a theatre trip to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. we booked via lastminute.com and appeared to get a really good deal, theatre tickets for Lord of the Rings and a nights accomadation for less that Â£100. Unfortunately we had transportation problems and had to find alternative transportation from Leicester to London. On the trip down to London we spent 2 hours trying to get through to the hotel to check what the latest time we could check in. Althought we were supposed to have been able to check in from 14:00 no one answered the phone until 17:00. We had chosen the Edward hotel because of its location and the amenities its claimed to offer. Such as en-suite bathroom, Satelite Tv in Room safe etc. We arrived at the hotel at about 23:30, had to wait for about half an hour whilst the night porter dealt with a group of italian tourists. The problem was, the night porter spoke rather broken english and no Italian. The italians meanwhile could also only speak rather broken English. Eventually we got checked in and headed up to our room. Upon arrival we found our room down a small dingy corridor. The room itself wasn't bad, 2 comfortable beds, which we simply pushed together to make a double bed. Its from this point on we had problems. My wife nipped the bathroom and came running back out, as she'd found what looked like a baby cockroach climbing the walls. I took a quick photo of it with my camera phone and then got rid of it. The amenities that the hotel boasts appear to be destinctly lacking - satelitie TV? you get Sky News and CNN and that's only if someone has remembered to turn the channel on downstairs. The in room safe was superbly secure, i couldn't even find it!!!! So there was no way any burgular was going to. The door didn't have any proper locking device, even the door chain was missing. The hotels only plus point was the free WI-FI available, although all the exposed routers on each floor does pang of a rather DIY approach- but as an IT engineer even i had to admit that it worked. At the end of the day however, if you are looking for a dirt cheap hotel in which to get a bit of kip then you could do worse, i know i have in the past, however if you want my adivce and can stretch to the extra cost then i'd stay in a travel lodge or similar, at the end of the day at least with them you know what you're paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Some where to lay your head for the Night”
Reviews.Author: welshgirlie007
Reviews.Content: We (me, hubby + daughter 12) stayed here one night in Feb '08. I paid Â£76 (through ASDA Travel) which included a full cooked breakfast. The room was very small, one double + one single bed, with a Small gap between the two. A double wardrobe. One shelf/ dressing table which had all the tea and coffee stuff and no where for me to place my makeup etc! The bathroom was ok, - basic. Room was clean and tidy. Basically the room served a purpose for us to use as a base and lay our heads after a night out at the west end. Don't think I could have stayed there long than the one night, due to the lack of comforts being squashed in the room and no luxuries of a hotel break. The staff on reception were polite but not overly friendly or much interaction. The breakfast was ok, I've had better for less money. The dining room was bland, no atmosphere, annoying music!! Location was the best and only reason we booked, close to hyde park and Paddington station, a tube ride to anywhere! Only use this hotel as a B/B, a cheap base to a trip to see the sights of London.

Reviews.Title: “A Warning Should Come With This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ELLENORTHERNIRELAND2
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner booked this Hotel via the interent, the pictures on the site looked reasonable (lets face it - it's not the Ritz) but I was very happy with the pictures on the website and it appeared to be very central to most attractions in London. We arrived at the Hotel prior to the 1pm check-in and would have been very happy to leave our luggage somewhere secure while we had a spot of lunch until we could check-in. UNLUCKY for us this was not the case! The receptionist that greated us virtually reduced us to tears! He threw a key at us for a room to place our bags screaming at us that it was not acceptable to arrive earlier than check-in time. I must admit that I did look at him in a manner that he obviously did not approve of but I have to say I was completely dumfounded. He then went on to ask for the key back - said we could "Do whatever the hell we liked we our bags - but they were not obligated to keep them!" I pondered the situation for a minute then informed him that we would go for some lunch and come back at check-in time. We went, had lunch and arrived back at 1'o clock. The pleasant receptionist had changed his tune when I asked him to write down the name of the manager - he bribed us with telling us in very poor English that he was giving us the nicest room in the Hotel - it was the suite and cost Â£150 per night but he would give it to us for two nights at no extra charge! I told him I would not accept such a thing as a apology for his behaviour and he insisted..............WELL..........................if this was the nicest room I would seriously HATE to have been staying in any other room in this Hotel. The carpet was sticky and dirty, their was black mould on the shower curtain, their was cigarettes all over the balcony furniture, other peoples hair in the bath and by 8'o'clock on our first evening we noticed we had no warm water or heat in the radiator! The TV looked like it was borrowed from a museum, most of the lights did not work, the walls needed a good lick of paint. It was bitter cold outside and wasn't much better indoors. We approached the same RECEPTIONIST who told us to let the water run for ten minutes! and give the heat about another half an hour and he would call up.................and he did! With a plug in radiator that was broke on two wheels. We froze in a dingy bedroom for two nights with no warm water and gave up trying to rectify the matter. I suffer from Asthma and left this establishment with a Chest Infection from a cold damp grotty room - I spoke to the Manager upon leaving who offered my Â£20 compensation but no apology! I took that matter one above her and the Group General Manager apologised on behalf of the RECEPTIONIST telling me that the receptionist is used to doing night shift and obvoiusly the daylight had something to do with hs behaviour! And that I should be grateful that he had tried to make amends offering me their suite! AND that I had already paid a really cheap rate for the hotel. (Â£70 PER ROOM PER NIGHT)! The Group Manager of course denied that the heat or the hot water were both on the blink and it's very easy to deny now that we are back in Northern Ireland. He proposes that when we next require accomodation in London if he has suitable accomodation available we can have a room with his compliments.................well over my dead body. I find it dispicable that establishments like this are allowed to continue operation. 2 star's is far too many for this Hotel and for Â£70 a night - I have stayed in better Hostels. I think Bed and Breakfast would be a better title for this place although I'm not sure about that either maybe HELL or something I don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Money”
Reviews.Author: vimtogirl
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a theatre package through lastminute.com. At 90GBP for two show tickets and a twin room for a one night mid-week break it was a bargain. After reading some of the previous reviews I was somewhat sceptical but I needn't have been. Chap at check-in was a little unfriendly, don't expect any polite conversation! The room, however, was a pleasant surprise. We had a twin on the 4th floor that, whilst being comically small (wouldn't liked to have stayed more than a couple of nights in such close quarters!) was clean, comfortable and adequately equipped, far better than I was expecting for a budget 2* hotel. TV with remote, Safe, tea/coffee making facilities, windows that actually open and a perfectly good ensuite. Even though our room was at the front of the hotel overlooking the road, traffic noise certainly wasn't a problem, nor were we disturbed by any "hotel" noise. And being only minutes from Paddington tube station we will definitely be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK.......Bedbugs!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Imhonest
Reviews.Content: Took two nights to realise that we were being bitten alive! We checked under the mattress and found a heap of bugs. We later found a mature female bug (the worst kind that lays up to 10-20 eggs a night) was feasting on our luggage!!! We went and spoke to reception and they moved us into a new room. I had my doubts but tried it anyway. When we got there, again....bugs under the mattress. We complained again and were upgraded to a room completely separate from the hotel....NO BUGS this time. The reception dude later accused us of bringing the bugs with us....hmmmmm!!!! We had friends arriving later that night and they were shown three rooms in the hotel, 2 of which had bedbugs sitting on the top of the bed as you entered! There was no need to even lift the mattress. Suffice to say, they chose not to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt go back..”
Reviews.Author: Riina8
Reviews.Content: At first we got this tiny room with a toilet that didn't flush. Next day they switched us to another one though thank god. Last night coming in to the hotel ( there were three in our party, in a single and double rooms) the receptionist was telling us no visitors are allowed ,which is fine- except we had paid for three and had NO visitors ! Going back to the room we noticed lights were already on and apparently , (eventhough it says in the toilet that if you wish your towels to be changed they should be put on the floor) they don't bring new ones in. Had to go to reception to ask for more and they refused to give us more than one per room. (?!) Working in a hotel myself I found the customer service of the night porter very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but great for the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: McHollywood
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay. The hotel is VERY central to Paddington Station, which was a HUGE Plus for touring around town. Yes, its a basic hotel, but at London Prices, who can complain. We had a triple on the 5th floor. We found that we didn't have water pressure and the moved us right away to the 3rd flr and everything was great! They even offered to move our luggage while we were out, but we did it ourselves. The rooms are basic, clean and fine for a tourist level hotel. Its not the Ritz, but I wasn't paying Ritz rates!! I would recommend the hotel to anyone as long as they knew it was sort of a Motel 6 type room in the US. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Eaten Alive!”
Reviews.Author: lance22
Reviews.Content: While I liked the staff our stay was ruined by bedbugs. Lots of them. I woke up in the middle of the night on our last night there and had four crawling all over me. I've never had this happen before, even in Mexico. Still gives me the creeps. DO NOT STAY THERE. IF A TRAVEL AGENT BOOKED YOU, PAY THE EXTRA CHARGE AND GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. There are numerous budget hotels in London where you will be happier.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel only good quality is location”
Reviews.Author: dgenasi
Reviews.Content: I'm not even sure where to begin: the arrangement of the room was awful, no remote, had to call twice for them to turn on our phone with broken buttons, internet machine in lobby ate my money, bathroom floor outside the shower was literally black from mold/mildew, faucets were rusty. The whole room and hotel generally felt unclean with subpar service. I dont have the picture of the hallway outside my bedroom but in short it had a rat trap and completely stained carpets. Picture can be sent upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Budget class but adequate”
Reviews.Author: terdec
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a budget class which means low price and small rooms but don't let this stop you from booking. The staff was helpful and the location was excellent. The showers at peak times lacked hot water and the drain in my room was a problem throughout my 6 night stay. I stayed there with a group of high school students and would book another group there without hesitation. The students got a taste of what most Europeans expect in a hotel room. Breakfast room was bright and most welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let The Bed Bugs Bite!”
Reviews.Author: N11B
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this place and even though it looked older it wasn't bad-at first. The elevator is tiny and the hallway leading to our room was narrow and dark. The room was ok- 4 beds and upstairs/downstairs. When we arrived we tried to take a shower but there was no hot water. The management came up to help us - made the water lukewarm and said we could get a maintnence person 'tomorrow.' While in the bathroom I noticed a couple of small black bugs in the shower. About an hour later my family and I sat around watching tv. We saw a small black bug crawling on the white bedding of one of the beds. It was the same bug seen in the bathroom. When we pulled back the sheets we found 10 bugs crawling around! We immedietly notified the person working at the desk who stated he didn't need to see the bedbugs because he believed us. No apology. Also he did not look surprised! We were so grossed out we left and found another hotel. Until this experience I didn't know bed bugs existed. It was a terrible experience!

Reviews.Title: “UGH!”
Reviews.Author: plepp
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Go-Today travel agency. Knew it was a budget hotel but why the owner of a property with a decent location would let it get so rundown-I do not know! We arrived and are told the lift is broken and will be out for 24 hrs. NO HELP in getting our bags up three STEEP flights of stairs! a 62 yr old man in the lobby said his 85 yr old father could not even walk down much less carry luggage down! No help! next day we were told the lift was out for two weeks! Obviously this was heavy duty planned maintainance that they knew in advance and did not notify the public or their travel agencies. But wait! Our tv was out the first day, they charge for internet but hey it was out! I had a new ac/dc converer that burned out after twenty minutes! The attidude at the desk was so what I won't carry your bags! Why they did not hire a temp to help elderly travellers with their bags is insane. Did not make a dime's adjustment to our bill either. The hotel should have been closed during this time! This hotel makes a motel 6 look like the Ritz! In Oct the room was hot and when you open the windows the traffic noise was horrible. A DUMP! We stayed at a budget hotel in Paris the next three nights-Larger room, quiet , freshly painted, everything worked and the front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jimlad2006
Reviews.Content: If you're going to have a late party and live out of town, this is a great little hotel. It's cheap, conveniently situated and the rooms are great value. I shared with a mate after the office christmas party, and it worked out to about Â£24 - much less than the cost of a taxi at 2am. Go for it - it's warm, the beds are clean and it's just nice knowing you can have a bit of a sleep in instead of commuting the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Room 208 - Room burgaled by hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: jpmcfly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during my first trip to London in which I had booked no accomodation prior to my visit. On arrival at paddington station it seemed a reasonable hotel from the foyer but little did I know the heartache this place would cause me. On arrival we were told that the room would not be ready and to come back in two hours time, on check in we noticed that the room number 407 had been scored out on the receipt and replaced with 208. The first night went without much problem but the evening of the second night before we went home things started to develop into a nightmare when we arrived at our room to find the exit door next to our room open. When we got inside our window was lying open and several items were stolen including a 60GB Ipod, iM3 Docking Station, 2 psp games and over Â£500 in cash. Our window was not open when we left so the only way in was from the inside itself, the window and susequently the fire escape were left open as to indicate to us how they got in. This however was no opportunist thief as our passports were left alone in the room on the table in plain sight as well as the fact that they would have covered their tracks a little better. Add to this the fact that the hotel refused to phone the police and you can see that something is not right about his hotel. The hotel have as yet refused to compensate me for this loss and I would advise anyone thinking of staying here to forget about it you will only get robbed if you have expensive items and they see them.

Reviews.Title: “Could be good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The foyer was lovely...then you hit the lift.....and you and you get an idea of the rest of the place. A narrow corridor lead to our room, which was tiny but rather cute. No ventilation we thought, and extremely tiny, but we can cope with that at least we have windows right!!!!!! A hint here " CLEAN THE BIRD DROPPINGS OFF THE WINDOWS". The rooms facing the street may have clean windows..but the windows in the rooms at the back are filthy with bird droppings, we could NOT see out our window at all, so we were not game to open it to get a bit of fresh air. On the other side of things, it is well priced and is staffed by nice people.Also there is everything you need right at hand including a GREAT indian resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Steph_Michelle
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. The first single room of my friends smelt so strongly of sewerage she had to get another room. Our room smelt ok, but after a night there we were all bitten by bed bugs, receiveing some nice red bites all over. They moved us and supposedly fumegated the room, but some of our things were missing in the process of the move. Would NEVER stay here again and advise all to stay away no matter how tempting the price! Health inspectors needed here!

Reviews.Title: “A good buy”
Reviews.Author: perbac
Reviews.Content: I was probably lucky because having booked a single room for four nights through hotels.com I was given a two bed room. It was quite a good room and the only complaint I have is TV reception which was sometimes OK, sometimes had OK sound but blurred image and sometimes dropped sound too. I mostly used BBC but sometimes zapped and sometimes found better quality for Sky and some less interesting channels. This came as no surprise having read an earlier review. My room was not towards the street so trafic noise was not a problem. Spring Street is also not a very busy road. The distance to the tube station is not very long. When I booked I did not realize that breakfast was not included but after having read an earlier review I checked the confirm message and it was not stated that breakfast was included. Not a big problem because I could make my own coffee with equipment and instant coffee provided in the room. Last morning I had forgot to buy something to eat for breakfast so I had the continental breakfast for Â£5. The lady in the breakfast room who checked my room number pointed out that breakfast was not included for me but I told her that I was going to pay for it. The continental breakast is better than at many other hotels, as both yoghurt (with or without fruit), muesli and other cereals, ready to eat grape fruit slices and other kinds of fruit were available. For the price Hotels charged for this hotel, Â£165 for four nights, it was a very good buy.

Reviews.Title: “Relieved - thought it was a great value”
Reviews.Author: gracie92110
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about the hotel after reading the reviews and tried to change hotels but was having a hard time meeting all our requirements anywhere else. So my husband and I were pleasantly surprised when the rooms were fine: decent size for Europe, cleaned daily, and serviceable. At $80 (including taxes but excluding breakfast ) through expedia, this was a *great* deal for London. (I don't think I'd pay more than $120 for a double, though.) Most of the staff was very friendly, and the night guy, who could be a bit grumpy, was fine with a little patience. BTW, the continental breakfast at 5 pounds was fine, but we liked Luigi's down the street on Spring Street--you could get a decent-sized breakfast for 3.5 pounds or less.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Edward Paddington
HotelInfo.Address: 1A Spring St | Paddington, London W2 3RA, England
